t: Job 10
Job Despairs of God’s Dealings
“I*pn loathe my own life; I*ln will give full vent to my complaint; I*ln will speak in the bitterness of my soul.
I*ln will say to God, ‘Do not condemn me; Let*ln me know why You contend with me.
Is*ln it right for You indeed to oppress, To*ln reject the labor of Your hands, And*ln to look favorably on the schemes of the wicked?
Have*ln You eyes of flesh? Or*ln do You see as a man sees?
Are*ln Your days as the days of a mortal, Or*ln Your years as man’s years,
That*ln You should seek for my guilt And*ln search after my sin?
According*ln to Your knowledge I am indeed not guilty, Yet*ln there is no deliverance from Your hand.
‘Your*ln hands fashioned and made me altogether, And*ln would You destroy me?
Remember*ln now, that You have made me as clay; And*ln would You turn me into dust again?
Did*ln You not pour me out like milk And*ln curdle me like cheese;
Clothe*ln me with skin and flesh, And*ln knit me together with bones and sinews?
You*ln have granted me life and lovingkindness; And*ln Your care has preserved my spirit.
Yet*ln these things You have concealed in Your heart; I*ln know that this is within You:
If*ln I sin, then You would take note of me, And*ln would not acquit me of my guilt.
If*ln I am wicked, woe to me! And*ln if I am righteous, I dare not lift up my head. I*iln am*i sated with disgrace and conscious of my misery.
Should*ln my*i head*i be lifted up, You would hunt me like a lion; And*ln again You would show Your power against me.
You*ln renew Your witnesses against me And*ln increase Your anger toward me; Hardship*ln after hardship is with me.
‘Why*ln then have You brought me out of the womb? Would*ln that I had died and no eye had seen me!
I*ln should have been as though I had not been, Carried*ln from womb to tomb.’
Would*ln He not let my few days alone? Withdraw*ln from me that I may have a little cheer
Before*ln I go—and I shall not return— To*ln the land of darkness and deep shadow,
The*ln land of utter gloom as darkness itself,*i Of*ln deep shadow without order, And*ln which shines as the darkness.”
